item.title: Setting up Neovim for Typescript - Part 1
item.description: Overall Goal of this Guide We will be creating an IDE-like experience with Neovim, specifically for Typescript development. tl;dr / I am an experienced (neo)vim user You may want to use a plugin manager; we are using vim-plug for the tutorial. Install coc-nvim and coc-tsserver. Copy the defaults in coc-nvim's README.md Getting Started vim-plug Installation If you do not already have a plugin manager set up for neovim, give vim-plug a try.
